mEvgim0NmiSqjCi7uSn66A.text: Great place and highly recommended!! We arrived early for our reservation and we were made very welcome. The waiter coached us to order several dishes with three differerent degrees of spicyness, from mild to medium to hot. I had the hot signature lamb dish.  It was pretty fiery but just fine for me. The medium and mild chicken and prawn dishes were loved by the others. We all very much liked the prawn appetizer.I have to say that everyone thought this was the best Indian restaurant they had ever tried.  Again, the waiter was great. The prices were reasonable.

8S0ATVcPaTY_mSROij6cgQ.text: Pappadam (appetizer) was similar to most other Indian restaurants - maybe worth it if you've acquired a pappadam taste, but I wouldn't get it again.Lamb biryani was exceptional. I wouldn't change a thing with the hotness/spice/flavor (it's a moderately spicy dish). Meen Kullambu (fish in a curry sauce) was pretty good, although I think it could be improved with a bit more curry and coconut flavor. The fish flavor was pretty mild so maybe the chef didn't want to overpower it, but overall it errors slightly too far on the mild side for my liking.Because this place is southern Indian they don't have naan. We had Coconut Rice and Chapati bread on the side. Both were good, although I thought the bread was a little greasy. Staff was friendly and gladly took our picture when we asked & chatted with us.We made a reservation with the web page, never got a confirmation email, but were still on the list & got seated right away.

NmqO-kUo0ZKAqFge52td-Q.text: I love Indian food and this wasn't your traditional Indian experience, since it was souther Indian food. I didn't know what to get and our waiter Jay was a great help in picking what to get. The service was great and extremely friendly. Overall the food was great and would recommend it to any one in the area.

gp6gKHs1RfKznOQfCT5NZw.text: Loved it!  We took our menu choices from the waiters recommendations. We selected their unique "southern Indian" dishes.  The prawns for a starter were amazing!  I have no idea what all of the items were called, but the three of us loved everything! Food was fresh and delicious, service was excellent. Restaurant was light and airy...

l1DchbkgACer8CJ8Dpn67g.text: Chettinad Restaurant is fantastic, and I've fallen in love with south Indian cooking. Chettinad Restaurant is bright, very clean, and full of blonde wood, very airy feeling, very classy. The food, however, is what makes this place a standout. My mom and I split a plain dosa, two curry dishes, the prawn and mild lamb. Both were flavorful and rich without being greasy, or overpoweringly spicy. As well as the curry we had the house salad, at first I was skeptical because iceberg lettuce was involved, but the light vinegar dressing, and the sweetness of the mango complemented each other perfectly.The waiter did forget our order of chai, but since he was still in training, I'll cut him some slack.

H8XDJJc7SA9v0Pc2yVAD3g.text: Im a south indian. This food is as close to reality as you can get! Mysore masala dosa, chicken appetizer, were the best! Also my friend liked chilli panneer a lot!

3b_fVaJmFCGURJkn2dUF2w.text: Excellent South Indian meal. The chef knows his flavors. Beautifully crispy Onion Masala Rava Dosa and very fresh and flavorful Vada Appetizer. Sambar and Coconut Chutney are the true test of a a South Indian restaurant...both were exceptional.

IwpZHDn9ElY9O6zPRibPmw.text: Last minute dinner decision while waiting for a show at the 100 Club. Great, prompt service, a pretty decent curry, moist veggie pakoras, and very decent prices.

7otC-jYGQyVUFnCS5lwLWQ.text: The food was average in this family owned and operated restaurant. Ok but nothing to go out of your way for.  But, half way through my lamb curry dinner I tilted the rice bowl and got a stream of water all over my food. I thought it was hot water to keep the rice hot. But it turned out to be dishwasher water leaking from a hole in the bowl's lining. They were quick to respond to my complaint (probably happened before). I got a fresh plate of rice but it looked like they just added some gravy to make up for the lamb curry that got washed away. BUT they offered no compensation on the bill, no dessert on the house. And to insult to injury tacked 12.5% tip on the bill (you should never tip the owner who is also the waiter in his own restaurant.) overall unpleasant experience. And what's with the candles in a place lit like up like day time?

3x5jl87WIBKGykFSuGM59g.text: I happened upon this place as a solo traveler finishing up an exhausting two weeks of research in London. Not only was the food good, the service was also amazing. Every dish was incredibly flavourful, very well priced, and every single member of the staff was incredibly kind, helpful and welcoming. The ambiance of the place is also worth noting. The decorations are quite elegant and this restaurant would be a great place for a date.

GLKTXAWPJkBUCC19unV3eQ.text: The place itself is easy to find, cute/cozy, with polite service, and has decent South Indian food. The saag paneer was flavorful, but not nearly spicy enough, and the pappadums were pretty absent of peppercorns.

1W20ITv3mM8rgb2THrVKCQ.text: I came to this restaurant not realizing the difference between Southern Indian and Northern Indian food, but I learned quite quickly after not being able to handle the spiciness of the food.  BUT the place gets 5 stars because the staff are some of the nicest and most accommodating around!  It doesn't get any better than this.  They brought me 3 different dishes in the hopes of finding something that I could eat.  They truly went above and beyond to make my meal satisfactory.  That said, the place is very low-key and nice, and my son and boyfriend (who can both handle spicier cuisine) both loved their dishes, Aadu Curry and Meen Curry.Highly recommended.

kxraLCPYzu0mvxuBh5ylcA.text: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!! We have never been for Indian food, but this was off the charts. We waited five minutes for a table, the waiter helped us choose foods we would like! We shared two appetizer, three main dishes, a couple beers, and more! Enjoy and ask for Jaya he was a great help!

7PkzVFKsEunyDl44lVl2ig.text: Nice South Indian place tucked away in central London! The kolli chukka is a must-have and the fish starters and appetisers are great. We also ordered the dosa which was ok. The service is competent at best (we had to cancel our poppadum since it didn't arrive until after the mains) but they did try to please with some chai on the house afterwards. Will definitely go back.

mw2uX82iHjqoyxzXv6WEQw.text: I was ready to like this restaurant because it got such great reviews, but I can't say I was impressed. The service was very attentive and they clearly cared about making a good impression, but the food was hit and miss. The big misses were the papadum and chapati, both of which were hard and stiff in places, like they were old or overcooked. They should be soft and pliable. These were dense and heavy. Admittedly these are northern Indian breads. I should have ordered the dosa, which is southern Indian and their specialty. I also ordered the chicken curry which was reportedly mother's special recipe, but the meat was a bit dry and the sauce nothing special. In one amusing incident I ordered a martini, which was on the drink menu. I was brought a shot glass full of vermouth. I questioned this and the waiter brought out a bottle of Martini vermouth and indicated that that is what I ordered. I specified gin and was given gin on the rocks. Should have ordered the beer, obviously. Anyway they did not charge me for the drink and were very nice about the whole incident. My wife had the vegetarian Thali and she enjoyed it, but admitted she had had better.

PTv18IHBGziltq_DptwJWQ.text: Delicious! We were pleased to get a table with no wait at this highly rated place. The dishes are generally spicy, but they also have some delicious kurmas if you're looking for something mild. Everything was really good and the service was excellent as well. The strawberry/lime juice is delicious.

3-XkG6sedjOLYWFGnq3Wbg.text: I've given it 3 stars but It's just very average. I tried this on holiday to London. Had the Lunch special but was disappointed in how ordinary it turned out to be after reading all the Hype on Yelp. The flavors were disappointing despite the fact that I asked to make it spicy. The waiter brought me sliced Chili pepper to eat with the meal but that's really not the way Indian cooking is made spicy. Everything was bland, nothing like South Indian food at all. There was no depth to the taste of the food at all.  I assumed it must be some sort of fusion cooking. They do pack a lot of little dishes in the lunch special(Lamb curry, Channa Dhal) but none really stand out at all. They could probably do better if they served it with pickles or a better Sambal, rather than 2 types of Raitha. The Dhosa was vegetarian, and again very bland. I would not go back there again, and in all honesty cannot recommend it at all.

58ChdGJpc-IS7xy4m-rwuw.text: Just loved the Eral Dosa and Gobi 65, it was tasty comfort food. My wife enjoyed the vegetarian thali, an excellent way to explore a variety of flavors. The service was very good and we will be heading back soon!

soFCWohu9LZpAt8e5mTiXg.text: Great South Indian food I had a Thali and it was loads. Plenty of space. People dining from all nationalities and I think always a good sign native of South India too.

vQcF5Rvxt_Kv2ZerrvIE9A.text: Wow!We went to London for a city trip on a budget and wanted to find the best food for no cost. We spotted this on yelp and found out about their lunch take away offer. You can get the vegetarian option for as little as £3.75 and the lamb or chicken option for just £3.95. We got two vegetarian lunches which consisted of bread, rice, an indian yogurth dip, some vegetable fried ball and two curries each. All was really great and they also provided cutlery and napkins. We walked to the closeby Bedford Square and sat on the ground just as everyone else did.This restaurant is a great option for everyone who wants to eat great Indian food, but is looking for an affordable lunch option (but I don't want to say that it was worse or that more expensive indian food would be any better). You can also have lunch in the restaurant for £6.95. The restaurant is very close to Oxford Street and thus perfect for those needing to relax between the shopping madness.

eLDrT5lLD3yK3LG3ZS0Dxg.text: This was the first Indian restaurant I tried upon arriving in London... the very first meal in fact after I landed. And sadly it was a disappointing one.Perhaps it was the dishes that I'd ordered... Chettinad lamb + gobi, perhaps it was the day I went... Monday evening. In either event, my lamb was over cooked and not tasty, and the bread I'd ordered came out soggy and limp.I found what I ordered to be over priced for the quality + portion of the food I received.The manager also personally walked over to every other table to check on their experience, offering complimentary desserts and/or other special treats to these other customers, but never once towards mine.Which needless to say does not make a girl feel welcomed.

uHTtlfJmOrHzB4zVN2LmoQ.text: Brilliant, humble South Indian restaurant with good value for money.We were warmly welcomed by the host and attended to with care by the waiter.Tip: the lamb is a real highlight.

otz_DMDFuIKC00rkNRBBSg.text: Great place, wonder why I discovered it only now! We went for lunch, I ordered the lamb thali lunch special, it came with a mini masala dosa, sambhar, chutney , dal and another vegetable. The Masala dosa was the best I have eaten in London, with flavourful sambhar that actually had some veggies and the coconut chutney was also delicious. The lamb - Chettinadu aadu,  was excellent and beautifully cooked. This is a great lunch deal for 8 quid. We also ordered a starter of chicken 65 - Poricha kolli,  again super. My friend ordered dal with spinach - Keerai parippu, and rice, she is from Chennai, and said it was well made, she also enjoyed the dosa. So that's full marks from a true blue Tamilian. The chapatti was not great, do don't order that, stick to dosa or the Kallu dosa as a side.

IN8zyXOn-m6tsHGdAIZFbw.text: Restaurant specializes in South Indian cuisine. Ordered vegetable kurma was very flavorful. Good with paratha bread. Friends ordered chettinad chicken and were also pleased. Possibly the best Indian food I've had.

photos.caption: Photo of Chettinad Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Vegetable kurma and paratha bread

vOB50G6u0RjgFpiBmFF8qQ.text: I am personally not a huge fan of Indian food. That said, I am a major fan of the food at Chettinad.  There is so much love in this food!  I ordered the Chicken Dosa and was very pleased.  The spices were wonderful without being overwhelming and that flat crispy wrap was perfection.  The place was packed, so I think it is safe to assume that most of the other patrons were of the same mind.  My friend ordered the spiciest chicken curry they had and even she seemed a little blown away -- even asked for more rice to soak up all the spicy sauce.  The prices are fair and I think they probably have some good lunch specials.  The service was outstanding and I really liked interacting with (read - asking stupid questions) our server and he had a lot of pride and love for the food he was serving.  Like I said, I am not usually a fan of Indian cuisine in the DC area, but this place has me coming around on the notion.  So, my only complaint is that it can get pretty loud in the dining space.  Other than that, this seemed to be a great date night restaurant with its mellow ambiance and sexy spicy food. Definitely check this place out!

R7iuCsB-PMrfr54D0T-WbA.text: Great restaurant that specializes in South Indian food. Service was a bit slow to start and we had to ask for menus and water after 5-10 minutes of nobody coming (wasn't a very busy night either). It did improve though once our food started coming out.We got the chili prawns, chicken dosa, eggplant curry and lamb curry. Everything was delicious, but I was particularly fond of the chicken dosa, which came in a thin, light wrapper that I could eat by itself. I was also pleasantly surprised at how none of the dishes were greasy, despite being spicy and flavorful. My (limited) experience with Indian restaurants in NYC has been that, especially the meat dishes, there's always a layer of oil floating above the sauce.

zCan5tW8Us3tX2rrTpCAYA.text: I read a lot about this restaurant before we walked in, but was disappointed. Not a bad place, but not a great place either. Value for money. Small tables, noisy people, low ceiling, ok decor, but cold beers. Don't ask for spicy as they could make it very very spicy, with your top sweating, so watch out.Friendly staff, but would have liked it more if they spoke English or even Indian for that matter..:(

bCjLKNwCldjvsKVL-xVWhQ.text: I found this place by chance when roaming around at lunch time looking for something different. As I have said on other reviews of south Indian restaurants, I'm from Kerala and tend to compare with what I get back home. The decor was pretty good here though they do have pictures of north Indian villages - not south Indian - which confused me. I decided to order a chicken biriyani which is my standard starting dish to measure how good a place is. Also it was the best thing I could get for the £10 limit I was on. The food took a while to come and I've made a mental note not to come for lunch again. But the food itself was pretty damn good. There were plenty of spices and half a boiled egg as well. The chicken was well done as well. All in all to will be going back but not for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Chettinad Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Chettinad Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. The ceiling has a saree hung under the window. Interesting

JSKUEzGnliGfdttOpKkG8g.text: I found out about Chettinad only earlier this summer. That surprised me a bit, since I had thought that I must have tried most of the good Indian restaurants that are there to be tried in central London. But I trusted the yelp reviews went ahead. I have been here twice so far, on both occasions it was for dinner, and the experience has been decidedly mixed. The food is good ... Not exceptional but good. I have tried the chettinad curries, both chicken and lamb, and have enjoyed both of them, especially the lamb. They might have been a bit too spicy for the average British palate, but that was how those dishes were meant to be. A friend tried the chicken dosa, which she found disappointing. For an Indian restaurant, there were surprisingly few vegetarian main courses available. But they did not disappoint. The service occasionally left a lot to be desired. The table for two had only one set of cutlery and napkin. We didn't get a complete second set in spite of asking repeatedly and had to borrow one from the empty adjacent table. The service was also quite slow on my last visit (which was on a Monday evening) in spite of the restaurant not being even half full. We had to wait an inordinately long amount of time before we could get anything, from food to water to the bill. The management could look into this. The decoration on the walls caught my eye. There were some traditional Indian implements and crafts, and from all over India and not merely from the South. The food was not expensive ... About £20 per person for a full meal. I will probably return if I am in the region and had a craving for South Indian food, but might not make the trek from elsewhere.

BrPTCvPWlDAiRVB4lGiG2g.text: Love their Masala Dosa!Staff are very friendly.I also really like the Mango Kulfi. I had better curries and the acoustics are a bit odd, so it seems very loud even though the place is not too big.Was my fifth visit and will definitely come back.

ypK6QmvKz_gsyDqdkL02tQ.text: Was looking forward to my first South Indian meal in a long time. The food was decent enough but nothing spectacular. The Chettinad Thali was quite alright - 2 chicken and 1 lamb dish along with 2 vegetable curries. The dishes were generally tasty although the chicken was a little tough. The paratha was unfortunately also a little too dry for my liking.

iZahiuY8KIwQZEx-VM_SvQ.text: Extraordinary service, made us feel at home from start to finish. Each and every bite of the food was delicious. Generous portions, full of flavor. So glad to have dined here before heading out of London. Highly recommend.

duD3Lc73PLOTPbXm-fZUfw.text: Lovely little South Indian restaurant in Fitzrovia. The dosa were outstanding - texture, flavor, and weight - everything you wanted from them and even offered for dessert with sweet toppings. The owner was personally overseeing the entire service and overall a lovely meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Chettinad Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Chicken dosa (interior)
Photo of Chettinad Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Chicken dosa
Photo of Chettinad Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Vadai (lentil doughnuts)

2g6OOht7HDwwnV7VOf8EOg.text: We had a wonderful dinner in London thanks to Kowshik and Arthur a few of the staff at Chittinad. The service and food was great, the ambience very classy. My husband and I both tried a samplers meal his with chicken and lamb mine vegetarian,  they were both wonderful and more than we could eat. We highly recommend!

Gf7KLBMkw8U97qo5tLUk7Q.text: Was there recently for lunch and had their south Indian tali and I have to say, it was not too bad. They had a fair amount of dishes, but the trick is not expect too much and you will be fine. Taste of some of their dishes were far from the original but to even find a south Indian restaurant in this part of London is a bonus in itself. Service - excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Chettinad Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Inside decor
Photo of Chettinad Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Inside
Photo of Chettinad Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Entrance

Q-GI8zDR2BtEBSfBt8zpDg.text: We were planning to head to Sagar next door, but veered towards Chettinad on a whim.  I'm glad we did - the masala dosa and lamb biryani were both excellent, the space is calm and elegant, the service was stellar, and the prices were reasonable.  My only regret is that I didn't order the Express Menu, which several people at the table next to us did, and they got huge platters full of delicious-looking stuff.  Next time...

wGIPPH5W5ns5oN9Dm19_6g.text: We had a fantastic meal here with our family.  It was the first time my nephew had eaten Indian food.  Everything was perfectly prepared and delicious, elegantly presented.  The service was fantastic.  I would highly recommend this restaurant.

K8rEfErVOMG7KrXln9RlMA.text: This restaurant provided me with the best Southern Indian cuisine I've ever had.

nJ5hV86FOjO8XTj4slX6Hw.text: Horrible service but decent food. After searching for a place to eat on Yelp we decided to try Chettinad since it was highly rated on Yelp. We came in around pm and it looks like they had 2 waitstaff and a manager that was running around trying to wait on everyone. The food was great , we had some dosa, lamb curry and seafood curry. I wouldn't recommend the seafood curry as much as it's not authentic as it should be. It was very sweet. Portions are very small for the price that you are paying (even when you are in London). Note to the owners. You have to hire more staff to support your growth. While the food is good , the wait for a table , food , drinks and our bill was extremely frustrating. Enough to stop me from coming again.

photos.caption: Photo of Chettinad Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Dosa, lamb curry and seafood curry

fUjq-ehJ1pT45Gi4OPAK1w.text: Indian fare which is adequate but unremarkable.  They appear to do a brisk take away service as well.  The bar was average at best but sufficient and offers some Indian beers as well as a European choice.  My chicken curry was good if a little tepid in terms of the sauce.  The lamb was overcooked a bit but okay too.  For a quick bite near the British Museum its okay if you have a hankering for a curry dish that won't set you back a lot of money.

yHyw9QC9bpe9470Se810VQ.text: Pathetic food. Do not let their name deceive you. No way authentic for the price they charge

qFI0lbHgNv2C3geeZd_nxw.text: OMG! Finally an Indian restaurant in London that I can whole heartedly recommend. Until now whenever a non-Indian friend in London has asked me where they can get good Indian food in central London, I answer some version of "an Indian home"Chettinad as their name suggests, focuses on the food from the Chettinad region of Southern India. It's almost 85% there in authenticity.  Spices have been subdued from this fiery cuisine, but the complexity of flavours is still present.The staff is very comfortable with their menu and love explaining the subtle differences to non-Indian visitors. From what I could hear at our neighbouring tables, they were quite accurate too. They are very very good with allergies, recommending I avoid the fried fish as it was fried in the same oil as the prawns (which I'm allergic to)The thali is always a great choice in an Indian restaurant, giving you a little bit of everything. We also loved the chicken biryani and the rasam. Let the wait staff know your spice tolerance and protein choices and let them recommend the best combination for you. The food was excellent and I can see us going back here multiple times.

photos.caption: Photo of Chettinad Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

rJ3QfzZjIMGDA-AlVtAGoA.text: Sorry, I do not write such reviews however I am.,so anyone who is looking for authentic Chettinad would not go in here. Worst lamb briyani, chicken curry, horrible service. Fish fry, paratha and poori were ok. Chicken fry was awful. Visiting London and have been eating for almost a week and this stands last in the list in terms of taste, service.

GaDK-MVKscBsEInvZndOTQ.text: Superb South Indian food with extremely attentive service.  The rava dose was tasty and not too oily, the gobi was spicy and served with an appealingly tangy sauce, and the appam was light.  The ambience was quiet and understated, and it was the type of place where people in shorts and suits all feel comfortable.  Outstanding.

JjseJptIxhDSaNxDJiDegQ.text: Fantastic South Indian cuisine - we had a chicken curry with bread, prawn biryani, and vegetarian dosa. Each dish was distinct and lighter than one would expect (a good thing - no grease here). Our waiter Arif was super helpful - his recommendations and this restaurant have helped introduce the cuisine to my gf with positive reception. Check it out if you're in the area and looking to mix up your food itinerary!

rGGUbSbajOxC3NMefXtX6w.text: We were originally thinking of going to one of the vegetarian South Indian places nearby instead, but I'm so glad we tried Chettinad instead! The interior is spacious but very nicely decorated. We had the chilli paneer to start, and it was spicy but not crazy, and only just mildly sweet, so I thought it was great. We ordered an aubergine kuzhambu and avial, with coconut rice and appams. The aubergine dish was sour and oaky and just spicy enough, and the avial was deliciously coconutty. The rice and appams were both great on the side, and we had just the right amount of food for two people. Our water glasses were always full, and the service was prompt and friendly. It was crowded on Saturday evening, but we got a seat in a few minutes without a reservation anyway.

xker3-Hz-7zXgbfb67xEyQ.text: WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER....!!!!I won't recommend this place ever to anyone....!!!!!!!!!!So it was written that the restaurant was open till 11 pm. We went at 10 pm to order food. The waiter there said in a bad tone "no no we won't serve food ". We said "But it said it is open till 11 pm , so we came " Then he said "no no". But then someone said that they will accept orders, and we took our order for take away, as it was already 10 o'clock.  At least learn how to talk to customers, then open  a business...!!!!!!

ivn_OwN_u1x6VDhEwxMjsw.text: This has to be one of the best value meals in London. The location is not too out  of the way and easy to get to - approximately an 8 minute walk from Oxford Circus tube and 2-minutes away from Tottenham Court Road. Once you get there for lunch, don't think much, just get the Lunch Special Thali. You can opt for the Chicken or Goat thali or just the veggie option. I got the chicken one for £7.75 and it comes with a chicken curry, 2 vegetarian curries, pulao, yogurt raita, masala dosa and chutney. That is a lot of food for one person & everything was delicious! In my thali I got the dry chicken curry in a coconut preparation which was medium spicy. My 2 veg curry dishes were the aubergine in a tomato curry (dry) and a mildly tempered coconut curry with carrots, beans and peas. I loved the coconut curry, it went really well with the pulao and the poppadum was the perfect accompaniment. And none of the oily, slimy dishes that seem to be a staple in some Indian restaurants (especially in our part of the world in NJ).However, the star of this meal was the mini masala dosa - the traditional Indian crepe with a yellow potato flavoring. This was one crisp dosa served right with the coconut chutney. Yes - you must be a real coconut lover to enjoy this meal as there were a lot of mouthwatering coconut-y flavors in the thali; typical of Chettinad cuisine from South India. If I had to nitpick I would comment that the curry dishes in the thali were not hot enough - my guess is that they served the curries and then dished out the dosa, which was nice and crisp. The service was quick and efficient, just like it should be during lunch hours. Also must point out that their lunch special for £7.75 is only till pm and I reached at 3.10 pm and put it in my order. After 3 pm it's or £9.99 but they were still nice enough to charge me or £7.75.I also got the nice strong cup of Indian Madras Coffee which was the perfect way to wrap this tasty lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Chettinad Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Chicken thali -  best 7.75 I ever spent!
Photo of Chettinad Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Madras coffee

0gg7UzcKC6izrwNcahHKJw.text: After wandering around in the rain at the Camden Market, our group was starving.We met with a friend and his parents in Chettinad for South Indian cuisine.  The restaurant was clean, had fairly modern decor, and was quite roomy by London standards.  The servers were very friendly, helpful, and accommodating -- we overstayed  (didn't know that the restaurant was closed between lunch and supper hours) and the staff didn't try to shoo us out the door or anything like that.  I ordered a refreshing mango lassi and it was deliciously creamy.  Our group didn't eat anything too adventurous (for some, it was their first time eating Indian food), so we enjoyed the usual dishes:Chicken samosas: wonderful flavour with a delightfully thin, crunchy wrapper.Kolli Dosa: Chettinad style rice and lentil crepe with chicken and potato filling.  This was my first time eating dosa, it's more like a Indian spiced version of Vietnamese banh xeo.  I thought that it was a bit bland.Thengai Aadu Kullambu: this mild lamb curry is a recipe from the head chef's grandmother.  The lamb was cooked in freshly grated coconut sauce, ginger, garlic, and aromatic curry leaves.  The flavour profile was absolutely amazing (the restaurant boasts freshly ground masalas)!Lemon rice: cooked with lemon juice, fresh curry leaves, lentils, and mustard seeds.  It was the perfect match for the lamb curry.Coconut rice:  Basmati rice mixed with fresh coconut, curry leaves, and black lentils.Saag paneer: spinach and Indian soft cheese with onion, garlic, and spices.  This was a very well balanced dish.Overall, I was quite pleasantly surprised.  This was definitely a true gem for South Indian food!

HMvzzcLD9VbDsR88K26c2A.text: This place is !  Absolutely loved the service, and the food was exquisite. Had the tiger prawns, long fish curry, chicken curry, daal, coconut rice and appams. Food is flavorful, but a bit on the spicy side. We LOVED it. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Chettinad Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Every dish was outstanding independently, and magic together.
Photo of Chettinad Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. The flavors and colors. Amazing.

g8u57ZLfU6Kbkn6KbM6i7A.text: We tried 3 new Indian restaurants this month and Chettinad is my favorite! Southern Indian with a deep complexity of flavors in our chettinadu kolli ( chicken curry) which linger a long time on the tongue after each bite. The menu says there are 23 different ingredients making up the spices and flavors of this dish.  (-;  Reminds me of spicy chocolate. The tomato rice complemented this dish.We enjoyed the masala dosa appetizer as well. It came with 2 tasty sauces. The service was very informative and helpful. The restaurant is pleasant and casual, and is off Tottenham court road, and it's on Percy.

photos.caption: Photo of Chettinad Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Ate at 3 Indian restaurants this month on vacation and chettinad is my favorite! (-;
Photo of Chettinad Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Tomato rice complemented my chettinad kolli. (-;
Photo of Chettinad Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Chettinad kolli with 23 different spice ingredients. Yes! I love it. Tastes like spicy chocolate, almost!

Mkhc_msTwTlJDstF4blPaQ.text: Went looking for good south Indian food and decided to enter this restaurant instead of the one next door. The ambience is better inside,then what it looks from outside.We were a couple and we ordered 1 lemonade,1mini dosa for starter,1 chettinad kolli(chicken in chettinad style), 1 plate paratha, and lastly 1 chicken biryani.Masala Dosa was good. It wasn't crispy but it had good flavour. Coconut chutney and sambhar was truly decious. Reminded me of my days in bangalore.Chettinad kolli was very very good. The spices were perfectly blended and the quantity was good as well.It paired well with paratha(kerala paratha aswe call it).I was not a big fan of biryani. It felt like rice mixed witj chettinad gravy and chicken was little bland.Meal for 2 came upto 35£. In the menu card it said after 6pm, the amount for the meal should be atleast 15£ per person, which I thought was weird and strange.Overall good food!

vtaG7KswLTbrn0XjScjPEw.text: I'm an Indian fishing for some authentic South Indian food in London and I happened to spot this on Yelp and boy am I happy! We ordered the Chettinad Chicken Curry, Poricha Kozhi (Chicken 65), Coconut Rice, and a Mysore Masala Dosa and they were all nothing short of amazing with the Dosa taking away the prize. The service could've been a bit faster although it wasn't particularly slow given the given the size of the crowd they were handling so I'm not taking away stars. Go for this if you need a South Indian feast!

p-qOTuTds5u-l9ReyyS61Q.text: If you have a dosa craving that needs to be sorted out, this is the place to do it. The aadu dosa (Dosa with lamb) is crispy and packed with delicious lamb and potato masala. The chutneys are all on point. And if you have any space left, wash it all down with their mango lassi. Top marks for South Indian food and exceptional service. They don't temper down the spice as they do in quite a lot of Indian restaurants in London and so the food is as authentic Chettinad as it gets.

xhvtY7ijOxSkzUilJosXmg.text: I arrived to this place just fooling around the city at night and craving Indian Food... after reading some of the reviews I thought that it was hard to get a table but I gave it a try.The place was full as expected on a Saturday night but the owner of the restaurant told me to wait 15 minutes... actually I was surprised for the short time because I saw people waiting, but 15 minutes was not bad after a 3 hour walking.When I've got sit, the service was prompt and very friendly. The girl who attended me was helpful and explained to me some items in the menu like the Dosa (actually, this is one of the things that I really wanted to try because I've read about Dosas in London were so good) and the Thalies. I ate the Onion Rava Dosa and a Thengai Kolli Kullambu, both were great and delicious. I asked the Thengai to be spicy hot... it was good, when i start sweating means good choice...ha ha ha :).If you are walking around Piccadilly Circus... you can walk 20 minutes north and get here. I recommend it. PS. It is not "open" network but if you want to connect to their wi-fi, they'll give you the password. Great !!!!!!!!!!!!  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Chettinad Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Delicious "Chicken Biryani"
Photo of Chettinad Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Potato Dosa!

KgeU_ubM5TJbge6GlijkOQ.text: Loved this place. We made reservations and it sure helped. We were seated promptly and the service was great.

NIDK5OkDf6JKImLCjTyMBA.text: Very good value on their lunch deal. Not everything was of great quality (there was one veg curry that was really nasty hot) but overall no complaints. The lamb curry was superb, the dosa also quite nice. Their gulab jamun hit the spot - and all for around 13 quid.
